Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2009 11:23AM Rhonda1966 wrote: Merry, I know this is a very difficult time, but you WILL get through it. There is light at the end of the tunnel! I was there two years ago and now that I have completed my treatment, I do not visit this board as much as I use to. However, it was great to have all these women to talk to and I will never forget how supportive everyone was. I tell myself everyday that there are many stage III survivors and I am gonna be one of them! And you will too! Hang in there ... it gets better I promise!

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2009 04:39PM Rhonda1966 wrote: Hi Miss-Di, Thank you for the encouraging words.  I see that you are stage IV with 3/3 positive nodes.  I am just curious why the surgeon did not take more nodes.  My surgeon removed 23 and found eight to be positive.  This really worries me ... I hope there is never any mets, but you can't help but wonder what the future may bring.  All we can do is trust in God! I wish you the best as well. Rhonda
Posts.Title: New Member Rhonda1966 KerryMac

Posts.Content: Rhonda1966 wrote: I am a new member here (yuck), but I have to say this is a great place to visit and chat and share feelings with others who are experiencing the same issues.  I was dx more than a year ago with ILC and have undergone a bilateral masectomy, chemo, and radiation.  I am currently still in the process of reconstruction.  So many of you here have supported me so much over the past year even though you had no idea.  I would love to talk with Karen1956 in Denver.  It sounds like our dx and plan of treatment is similar.  Please email me.  My address is rdevane@rockfishestates.com.  I look forward to hearing from you. Rhonda D. Dx 4/24/2007, ILC, 4cm, 8/23 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
